articles.author: TIM McKEOUGH
articles.title: This private urban oasis lets the outside in
articles.description: In one Los Angeles home, it’s difficult to tell where the house ends and the yard begins. And that’s the way the owners like it.
articles.content:
At David and Jamie Thompsons house in the Studio City neighborhood of Los Angeles, its easy to lose track of where the house ends and the yard begins.
The 5,380-square-foot home, which David Thompson, the founding principal of the Los Angeles-based architect… [+4668 chars]

articles.author: Jill Cowan
articles.title: New California Laws in 2020
articles.description: Tuesday: Count ’em. (Or don’t. There are a lot.) Also: A California Green New Deal, and John Baldessari.
articles.content: And Mark Baldassare, the president and chief executive of the nonprofit Public Policy Institute of California, told me that in addition to the aforementioned consumer privacy law, there are a lot of unsettled questions about the rollout of the states landmark… [+1500 chars]

articles.author: Caitlin Wolper
articles.title: Why is there a coffee shop in so many stores?
articles.description: Boutiques of all kinds are beginning to look a lot like cafes.
articles.content:
The joke used to be that theres a Starbucks on every corner in New York City. Now theres coffee in the corner of almost every store.
At Lichen, a boutique in Williamsburg that sells home goods and furniture, you can pick up Danish glass cups for $7, an Itali… [+4740 chars]

articles.author: Shane Goldmacher and Astead W. Herndon
articles.title: Warren Rolls Out a Bankruptcy Plan, Reviving an Old Clash With Biden
articles.description: Elizabeth Warren called for repealing provisions of a 2005 law that Joseph R. Biden Jr. supported when he was in the Senate.
articles.content:
I got in that fight because they just didnt have anyone, Ms. Warren said, and Joe Biden was on the side of the credit card companies.
But that proved to be more of an isolated note. Throughout the 2019 debates, Ms. Warren avoided directly confronting Mr. Bid… [+1160 chars]

articles.author: Raphael Minder
articles.title: Pedro Sánchez Will Lead Modern Spain’s First Coalition Government
articles.description: The Socialist leader won approval from Parliament and will now run a fragile grouping of left-leaning parties whose survival may hinge on the separatist dispute in Catalonia.
articles.content:
On Sunday, in the first round of voting by lawmakers, Mr. Sánchez failed to gain the absolute majority that he needed. But on Tuesday he needed only to receive more votes in favor than against.
The conflict over Catalonia dominated the acrimonious parliament… [+1235 chars]

articles.author: David Leonhardt
articles.title: No One Believes Trump
articles.description: Which isn’t good in an international crisis.
articles.content:
A president with credibility would be able to set clear red lines that might influence Irans behavior in coming weeks.
But President Trump has no credibility. His political rise was built on a lie (about Barack Obamas birthplace). He has told thousands of un… [+2359 chars]

articles.author: Danya Issawi
articles.title: A Decade of Turbulence, Family Love and Basketball
articles.description: When Charon Francis-Hartley split with her partner, financial insecurity ensued. Between the difficulties, she and her children found an escape on the court.
articles.content:
As the daughter of a single mother, Ms. Francis-Hartley had witnessed the sacrifice that road demands. And for her, the separation from her partner meant financial insecurity, which she was familiar with as well.
When I walked out, it was like, no regrets, s… [+1111 chars]

articles.author: Vivian Yee and Megan Specia
articles.title: Stampede at Iranian General’s Funeral Kills 32
articles.description: The crush at a procession honoring Maj. Gen. Qassim Suleimani in his hometown after his killing in a U.S. airstrike also injured up to 190 people, the state news media reported.
articles.content:
Pictures of the procession showed an elaborately decorated truck bearing General Suleimanis coffin through streets packed so densely with mourners that, in overhead photographs, the ground was not visible. 
Many in the crowd wore black and carried pictures o… [+838 chars]

articles.author: Reuters
articles.title: Goldman Sachs Renames Business Units Ahead of Quarterly Results - The New York Times
articles.description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc has overhauled its main business units ahead of its quarterly results next week, the Wall Street bank said on Tuesday, as it seeks to provide investors with greater transparency into its financial performance.
articles.content:
